intro: Phthirusa alternifolia, commonly known as the alternate-leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often resembling a globular or cylindrical shape. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Phthirusa alternifolia is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and diverse growth forms.
